folder: Jackson Street & Water Street, Manhattan, NY
text:
Corlears Hook Park: Children tilling their gardens in the northwest corner of same. Buildings shown are on the west side of Jackson Street, between Water (left) and Cherry (right) Streets.

Summer 1923.

P. L. Sperr.

folder: South Street & Jackson Street, Manhattan, NY
text:
(Corlears Hook Park: The northwest corner of same, as viewed northward on Jackson Street (western boundary of Park) from South Street. Appearing on the right is St. Rose's Home, at the N.W. corner of Jackson and Front Streets. Buildings seen aoross the Park are on the north side of Cherry Street, between Jackson and Corlears Streets.
April 16, 1928.
P. L. Sperr.

folder: Jackson Street & South Street, Manhattan, NY
text:
View 1:
Jackson Street, from South Street, showing St. Marys School adjoining on the southwest
corner of Front Street.
NEd6 ~31G7  July 18, 1939.
This photo is in the right location.  However, it is not St. Mary's School.  It is St. Rose's Free Home for Incurable Cancer.  Erected on this site in 1911.
View 2:
South Street, north west corner and Jackson Street, showing demolition.
August 14, 1939.
View 3;
Jackson Street, west side at south Street looking south from Front Street, at south west corner of Front Street, St.Mary's School,R.C.
P.L.speer.
NO REEROIT:TION.  August 15, 1N39.

folder: Water Street & Jackson Street, Manhattan, NY
text:
View 1:
Water Street, west from Jackson Street, showing demolition of north side of Street.

August 15, 1939.

View 2:
Jackson Street,north side at the north west corner of Water Street, looking towards northwards.

June 24, 1939.

View 3:
Jackson Street, east side at the north east corner of Jackson and Monroe Street, showing demolition.

June 1, 1939.

P.L. Sperr.

folder: Jackson Street & South Street, Manhattan, NY
text:
Jackson treet, porth from South Street,
showing St. Sarys R.C. school at the
south west corner of Front Etreet, and
facing Corleabs Park.
P.L.Speer.
NO EERODU:TION. April 7, 1940.

This is not St. Mary's School.  On the corner of Jackson Street and Front Street the building in view was St. Rose's Free Home for Incurable Cancer from 1911 - 1954.  A new building was completed on the site in 1956.

folder: 71-67 Jackson Street - Front Street, Manhattan, NY
title: 71-67 Jackson Street - Front Street
